dublin_core.dcvalue: Because pediatric cardiologists can accurately diagnose innocent murmurs by physical exam alone the authors developed a system for remote cardiac auscultation They hypothesized that their system could accurately classify auscultatory findings as normal innocent or pathologic Patients undergoing evaluation underwent examination echocardiography and heart sound recording Pediatric cardiologists evaluated the heart sounds and classified the case as either normal innocent or pathologic They reviewed103 heart sound data sets 85 of the cases were accurately classified as either normal innocent or pathologic with a sensitivity of 82 and specificity of 86 However when accounting for clinical diagnosis reviewer uncertainty and ECG abnormalities the sensitivity and specificity improved to 91 and 88 accuracy 89 respectively Degree of certainty with the telecardiology diagnosis correlated with correct interpretation P Under 005 Digital heart sound recordings evaluated via telemedicine can distinguish normal innocent murmurs from pathologic ones Such a system could improve the use of pediatric cardiology services
Utility of store-and-forward pediatric telecardiology evaluation in distinguishing normal from pathologic pediatric heart sounds.
